subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.
author: Rj
full_text:
--0-1562401566-1243607101=:9983
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

If I were Frank, and I were going to proceed with a partnership with someon=
e, I'd get some things in writing, in contract form, stating what Frank is =
going to do for the partner, and what the partner is going to give Frank.=
=A0 For example (and purely hypothetically), if the partner were promising =
Frank some kind of dollar amount for using Frank's tech, that would be a mi=
stake, since the partner could simply under-report his income to Frank.=A0 =
Instead, get a fixed payment up front, maybe yearly (like a licensing cost)=
.=A0 And if Frank were to make units for a partner to sell, make the partne=
r pay for the units before Frank delivers them (like most product distribut=
ion works: the partner can then mark them up as he sees fit).=A0 Also inclu=
de some non-disclosure language in the contract, so the partner could not j=
ust take what Frank has and duplicate it.

I'm no lawyer, but I would also =
make it clear, signed and in writing, what the relationship of the partners=
hip is: like "<Name> has no claim upon any technology developed or disclose=
d during this project.=A0 Any claims made by <Name> thereof would need to b=
e covered specifically by a separate contract and approved by Frank.=A0 <Na=
me> is a voluntary, non-paid=A0 member of this project, participating for e=
ducational and recreational purposes only.=A0 Any claims made my <Name> bey=
ond this would be false, and could result in prosecution for (but not limit=
ed to) slander, defamation , loss of income, theft, and fraud.

--- On Fri,=
 5/29/09, April Abercrombie <april@...> wrote:

Fr=
om: April Abercrombie <april@...>
Subject: Re: [EV=
P-ITC] Different chip config.
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Friday, May=
 29, 2009, 7:00 AM











    
            
            


      
     =
 


I think the bottom line is we all know that 
Chris Moon is probably jus=
t trying to use you. He'll suck you dry and toss you 
aside when he gets hi=
s fill.
=A0

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: 
  Fransen, Debbie 
  =
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
  Sent: Friday, May 29, 2009 7:45 AM
  Subjec=
t: RE: [EVP-ITC] Different chip 
  config.
  

  
  
  Exactly my point... =
You don't charge anything for the 
  boxes
  and Chris Moon charges people =
for using 
  it....
  If it's not perfected then Chris shouldn't charge 
  =
either......
  If he wasn't so public with it, then people like me wouldn't=
 
  dislike him so much.
  =A0
  The only people that have your boxes (that=
 the public hear 
  about)
  are the well known paranormal groups and famou=
s 
  people.
  I am sure that you have given boxes to researchers who are 
=
  not in the popular
  paranormal community ,and don't want to be. Those ar=
e the 
  ones that should
  get respect.=A0 And of course YOU are well resp=
ected by 
  us lowly researchers. ( Kissin up , so you won't get mad)
  =A0=

  And I am sure that you are sick of hearing about Chris Moon 
  and how
 =
 alot of people thinks he sucks. And everyone wants a 
  box......
  But yo=
u have to expect that. You are the only one out there 
  that is honest and=

  doesn't want to be famous.
  I know this is like beating a dead horse, s=
o I will shut up 
  now.... :)
  =A0
  =A0

  
  
  From: EVP-ITC@yahoogrou=
ps .com 
  [mailto:EVP- ITC@yahoogroups. com] On Behalf Of Frank 
  Sumptio=
n
Sent: Friday, May 29, 2009 9:22 AM
To: 
  EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Subjec=
t: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip 
  config.


  
  
  
  =A0Keep in mind the=
 money thing works two ways, I also don't 
  sell/charge for the boxes. Som=
eday=A0I will--when it's perfected!
  =A0
  =A0Frank-S

2009 at 6:16 AM, Fransen, Debbie <debbie.fransen@ delta.com> 
  wrote:

    course Chris Moon speaks highly of h=
im.

@yahoogroups .com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com] On Behalf Of Elaine

    config.


 =
   
    
    
    
    
    
    
    Okay, then could I have a copy of the=
 new schematic when you get it 
    drawn?=A0 That would be even better.=A0=
 Where are you from?=A0 
    Chris Moon speaks highly of you.

    

    
 =
   
    From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoo=
groups .com
Sent: Thursday, May 28, 2009 2:29:09 
    PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-=
ITC] 
    Different chip config.


    
    Besides--I didn't like that rad=
io design, it's too complex, and the 
    documentation is screwy. I did a =
simpler radio last night that should be 
    better, simpler, cheaper, and =
clearer sound. 


    On Thu, May 28, 2009 at 5:41 AM, Elaine Coates <cozyk=
at2003@ yahoo.com> wrote:

    
      
      
      
      


      
      =

      The jpg for this schematic is kind of blurry in places.=A0 Is 
     =
 there any way a more clear copy could be send to me? I would be forever 
 =
     grateful.=A0 Thanks Frank - Elaine

      

      
      
      
     =
 From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups =
.com
Sent: Thursday, May 28, 2009 12:55:00 
      AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC]=
 
      Different chip config.


      
      
      http://purplealieng ir=
l.tripod. com/ 
      
      =A0
      =A0However, it's constantly changing=
. The radio I made tonight is 
      very simple, and can significantly sim=
plify construction. I used to make 
      the sweep and amplifier circuits,=
 then use a commercial radio, like the 
      12-469, as a tuner. 
      =
=A0
      =A0The MK484 is follwed by a couple high impedence op amp stages =

      to bring the audio up to line levels. I haven't had time to do schem=
atic 
      yet. I draw the schematics with MS paint, and they are stored a=
s jpeg 
      images, which isn't=A0the best, but it makes them e-mailable.=
 
      =A0
      =A0Frank-S


      
      On Wed, May 27, 2009 at 8:54 PM=
, Elaine Coates <cozykat2003@ yahoo.com> wrote:

      
        
        
 =
       
        


        
        
        
        Hi folks, I just join=
ed this group.=A0 I was recently at the 
        Lizzy Borden house in Mass=
achusetts with Chris Moon and had a session 
        with Frank's Box.=A0 T=
he results were astounding.=A0 Is this the 
        newest schematic for Fr=
ank's box?=A0 If so, is there a way to get a 
        clearer copy of it?=
=A0 My son said he would build one for me and I 
        have been searchin=
g for the schematic.=A0 Can anyone help? - 
        Elaine

        

     =
   
        
        
        From: Frank Sumption 
        <purplealiengir=
l@ gmail.com>
To: evp-itc@yahoogroups .com; grassharp@yahoogrou ps.com 
   =
     
Sent: Wednesday, 
        May 27, 2009 5:45:16 PM
Subject: [EVP-ITC] =
Different chip 
        config. [1 Attachment]

        
        

        =

        
        =A0I think I followed an erroneous LM3820 layout, so I'm =
going 
        to breadboard this layout. Note the antenna input is now on =
pin 12-11, 
        this is the RF amp input, and pin 13 is the RF amp outp=
ut, which feeds 
        pin 1.
        =A0
        =A0'case anyone cares. =

        =A0
        =A0F-S
